headline: SoftBank Unloads Nvidia Stake for $5.8 Billion in Surprise Move
summary: The sale comes ahead of a rash of planned investments by founder Masayoshi Son to build his own sphere of influence supporting artificial intelligence.

content.title: SoftBank Unloads Nvidia Stake for $5.8 Billion in Surprise Move
content.summary: The sale comes ahead of a rash of planned investments by founder Masayoshi Son to build his own sphere of influence supporting artificial intelligence.

headline: Japan's SoftBank says it has sold its shares in Nvidia for $5.8 billion, turning its focus to OpenAI
summary: Japanese technology company SoftBank Group Corp. said Tuesday that it has sold all the Nvidia Corp. shares that it owned for $5.83 billion, while it reported its profit nearly tripled in the first half of this fiscal year from a year earlier.  Tokyo-based SoftBank Group Corp. said it sold the stake in Silicon Vally-based Nvidia in October in a move that reflects its shift in focus to OpenAI.  In February, its chairman Masayoshi Son joined Trump, Sam Altman of OpenAI and Larry Ellison of Oracle in announcing a major investment of up to $500 billion in a project to develop artificial intelligence called Stargate.

content.title: Japan's SoftBank says it has sold its shares in Nvidia for $5.8 billion, turning its focus to OpenAI
content.summary: Japanese technology company SoftBank Group Corp. said Tuesday that it has sold all the Nvidia Corp. shares that it owned for $5.83 billion, while it reported its profit nearly tripled in the first half of this fiscal year from a year earlier.  Tokyo-based SoftBank Group Corp. said it sold the stake in Silicon Vally-based Nvidia in October in a move that reflects its shift in focus to OpenAI.  In February, its chairman Masayoshi Son joined Trump, Sam Altman of OpenAI and Larry Ellison of Oracle in announcing a major investment of up to $500 billion in a project to develop artificial intelligence called Stargate.

thumbnail.caption: FILE - A woman walks in front of SoftBank store in Ginza shopping district in Tokyo, Jan. 20, 2020. (AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko, File)

headline: Block Reign, Inc. Showcases Momentum Around the Gnodi Blockchain
summary: Block Reign, Inc. today announced growing adoption of the Gnodi Blockchain, a decentralized Layer-1 network built to make blockchain usable for real people and everyday products. Users are engaging with Gnodi powered apps, more operators are standing up nodes, and businesses and organizations are exploring the network as a secure, community-aligned foundation.

headline: Nucleus Research Releases 2025 WMS Technology Value Matrix
summary: The warehouse management market in 2025 reflects a shift from efficiency to resilience. Cost volatility, labor shortages, and trade disruptions have made the warehouse a central point of supply chain visibility and control. Organizations are balancing smaller, more frequent orders with higher transportation and labor costs while holding more inventory to offset risk. Modern warehouse management systems (WMS) have become key to managing these pressures, delivering measurable ROI through improved

Cost volatility, labor shortages, and trade disruptions have made the warehouse a central point of supply chain visibility and control. Modern warehouse management systems (WMS) have become key to managing these pressures, delivering measurable ROI through improved

headline: SoftBank Sells Nvidia Stake for $5.8 Billion to Fund AI Bets
summary: Founder Masayoshi Son has been unwinding positions to pay for a plethora of AI projects, from Stargate data centers with OpenAI and Oracle Corp. to robot manufacturing sites in the US.  The Nvidia exit coincides with a growing debate about whether spending by big tech firms like Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc. — expected to surpass $1 trillion in coming years — will produce commensurate returns.

content.title: SoftBank Sells Nvidia Stake for $5.8 Billion to Fund AI Bets
content.summary: Founder Masayoshi Son has been unwinding positions to pay for a plethora of AI projects, from Stargate data centers with OpenAI and Oracle Corp. to robot manufacturing sites in the US.  The Nvidia exit coincides with a growing debate about whether spending by big tech firms like Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc. — expected to surpass $1 trillion in coming years — will produce commensurate returns.

headline: Nucleus Research Releases 2025 CPQ Technology Value Matrix
summary: The Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) market in 2025 is driven by the growing cost of inaction. Organizations that continue to rely on outdated systems face slower quote cycles, shrinking margins, and revenue leakage that directly reduce profitability. As pricing volatility and product complexity rise, modern CPQ platforms have evolved from operational tools to strategic systems that enhance agility, accuracy, and financial performance.

content.title: Nucleus Research Releases 2025 CPQ Technology Value Matrix
content.summary: The Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) market in 2025 is driven by the growing cost of inaction. Organizations that continue to rely on outdated systems face slower quote cycles, shrinking margins, and revenue leakage that directly reduce profitability. As pricing volatility and product complexity rise, modern CPQ platforms have evolved from operational tools to strategic systems that enhance agility, accuracy, and financial performance.

headline: Oracle share price weakness offers a buying opportunity, says Mizuho
summary: Investing.com -- Oracle (NYSE: ORCL) shares fell around 3% after CoreWeave’s (NASDAQ: CRWV) third-quarter earnings disappointed investors, but Mizuho analysts believe the weakness is “largely unwarranted” and presents “a buying opportunity” for Oracle ahead of its fiscal second-quarter results in December.
